Welcome to SiPANN’s documentation!¶

class SiPANN.dc.AngledRR(width, thickness, radius, gap, theta, sw_angle=90)¶
clean_args(wavelength)¶

Makes sure all attributes are the same size

gds(self, extra=0, units='nm')¶

Writes the geometry to the gds file

Parameters

  • filename (str) – location to save file to, or if you don’t want to defaults to None

  • extra (int) – extra straight portion to add to ends of waveguides to make room in simulation (input with units same as units input)

  • units (str) – either ‘microns’ or ‘nms’. Units to save gds file in

  • view (bool) – whether to visually show gds file

  • sbend_h (int) – how high to horizontally make additional sbends to move ports farther away. Sbends insert after extra. Only available in couplers with all horizontal ports (input with units same as units input)

  • sbend_v (int) – same as sbend_h, but vertical distance.

predict(ports, wavelength)¶

Predicts the output when light is put in the bottom left port (see diagram above)

Parameters

  • ports (2-tuple) – Specifies the port coming in and coming out

  • wavelength (float/np.ndarray) – wavelength(s) to predict at

Returns

returns the value of the light coming through

Return type

k/t (complex np.ndarray)

update(**kwargs)¶

Takes in any parameter defined by __init__ and changes it.

SiPANN.dc.C = 299792458¶

Helper Functions used throughout classes

class SiPANN.dc.DC(width, thickness, sw_angle=90)¶

Base Class for DC. All other DC classes should be based on this one, including same functions (so documentation should be the same). Ports are numbered as:

2— /—4

1—/ —3

clean_args(wavelength)¶

Makes sure all attributes are the same size

abstract gds(filename=None, extra=0, units='microns', view=False, sbend_h=0, sbend_v=0)¶

Writes the geometry to the gds file

Parameters

  • filename (str) – location to save file to, or if you don’t want to defaults to None

  • extra (int) – extra straight portion to add to ends of waveguides to make room in simulation (input with units same as units input)

  • units (str) – either ‘microns’ or ‘nms’. Units to save gds file in

  • view (bool) – whether to visually show gds file

  • sbend_h (int) – how high to horizontally make additional sbends to move ports farther away. Sbends insert after extra. Only available in couplers with all horizontal ports (input with units same as units input)

  • sbend_v (int) – same as sbend_h, but vertical distance.

abstract predict(ports, wavelength)¶

Predicts the output when light is put in the bottom left port (see diagram above)

Parameters

  • ports (2-tuple) – Specifies the port coming in and coming out

  • wavelength (float/np.ndarray) – wavelength(s) to predict at

Returns

returns the value of the light coming through

Return type

k/t (complex np.ndarray)

sparams(wavelength)¶

Returns sparams :param wavelength: wavelengths to get sparams at :type wavelength: float/np.ndarray

Returns

frequency for s_matrix in Hz, size n (number of wavelength points) s_matrix (np.ndarray): size (4,4,n) complex matrix of scattering parameters

Return type

freq (np.ndarray)

gds(filename=None, extra=0, units='microns', view=False, sbend_h=0, sbend_v=0)¶

Writes the geometry to the gds file

Parameters

  • filename (str) – location to save file to, or if you don’t want to defaults to None

  • extra (int) – extra straight portion to add to ends of waveguides to make room in simulation (input with units same as units input)

  • units (str) – either ‘microns’ or ‘nms’. Units to save gds file in

  • view (bool) – whether to visually show gds file

  • sbend_h (int) – how high to horizontally make additional sbends to move ports farther away. Sbends insert after extra. Only available in couplers with all horizontal ports (input with units same as units input)

  • sbend_v (int) – same as sbend_h, but vertical distance.

predict(ports, wavelength, extra_arc=0, part='both')¶

Has aditional ‘part’ parameter in case you only want magnitude (mag) or phase (ph)

Takes in any parameter defined by __init__ and changes it.

  • filename (str) – location to save file to, or if you don’t want to defaults to None

  • extra (int) – extra straight portion to add to ends of waveguides to make room in simulation (input with units same as units input)

  • units (str) – either ‘microns’ or ‘nms’. Units to save gds file in

  • view (bool) – whether to visually show gds file

  • sbend_h (int) – how high to horizontally make additional sbends to move ports farther away. Sbends insert after extra. Only available in couplers with all horizontal ports (input with units same as units input)

  • sbend_v (int) – same as sbend_h, but vertical distance.

gds(filename=None, view=False, extra=0, units='nms')¶

Writes the geometry to the gds file

Parameters

  • filename (str) – location to save file to, or if you don’t want to defaults to None

  • extra (int) – extra straight portion to add to ends of waveguides to make room in simulation (input with units same as units input)

  • units (str) – either ‘microns’ or ‘nms’. Units to save gds file in

  • view (bool) – whether to visually show gds file

  • sbend_h (int) – how high to horizontally make additional sbends to move ports farther away. Sbends insert after extra. Only available in couplers with all horizontal ports (input with units same as units input)

  • sbend_v (int) – same as sbend_h, but vertical distance.

  • wavelength (float/np.ndarray) – wavelength(s) to predict at

gds(filename=None, view=False, extra=0, units='nms')¶

Writes the geometry to the gds file

Parameters

  • filename (str) – location to save file to, or if you don’t want to defaults to None

  • extra (int) – extra straight portion to add to ends of waveguides to make room in simulation (input with units same as units input)

  • units (str) – either ‘microns’ or ‘nms’. Units to save gds file in

  • view (bool) – whether to visually show gds file

  • sbend_h (int) – how high to horizontally make additional sbends to move ports farther away. Sbends insert after extra. Only available in couplers with all horizontal ports (input with units same as units input)

  • sbend_v (int) – same as sbend_h, but vertical distance.

gds(filename=None, view=False, extra=0, units='nms', sbend_h=0, sbend_v=0)¶

Writes the geometry to the gds file

Parameters

  • filename (str) – location to save file to, or if you don’t want to defaults to None

  • extra (int) – extra straight portion to add to ends of waveguides to make room in simulation (input with units same as units input)

  • units (str) – either ‘microns’ or ‘nms’. Units to save gds file in

  • view (bool) – whether to visually show gds file

  • sbend_h (int) – how high to horizontally make additional sbends to move ports farther away. Sbends insert after extra. Only available in couplers with all horizontal ports (input with units same as units input)

  • sbend_v (int) – same as sbend_h, but vertical distance.

class SiPANN.dc.Straight(width, thickness, gap, length, sw_angle=90)¶
clean_args(wavelength)¶

Makes sure all attributes are the same size

gds(filename=None, view=False, extra=0, units='nms', sbend_h=0, sbend_v=0)¶

Writes the geometry to the gds file

Parameters

  • filename (str) – location to save file to, or if you don’t want to defaults to None

  • extra (int) – extra straight portion to add to ends of waveguides to make room in simulation (input with units same as units input)

  • units (str) – either ‘microns’ or ‘nms’. Units to save gds file in

  • view (bool) – whether to visually show gds file

  • sbend_h (int) – how high to horizontally make additional sbends to move ports farther away. Sbends insert after extra. Only available in couplers with all horizontal ports (input with units same as units input)

  • sbend_v (int) – same as sbend_h, but vertical distance.

predict(ports, wavelength)¶

Predicts the output when light is put in the bottom left port (see diagram above)

Parameters

  • ports (2-tuple) – Specifies the port coming in and coming out

  • wavelength (float/np.ndarray) – wavelength(s) to predict at

Returns

returns the value of the light coming through

Return type

class SiPANN.dc.Waveguide(width, thickness, length, sw_angle=90)¶

Lossless model for a straight waveguide. Ports are numbered as:

1 ============== 2

clean_args(wavelength)¶

Makes sure all attributes are the same size

gds(filename=None, extra=0, units='microns', view=False)¶

Writes the geometry to the gds file

Parameters

  • filename (str) – location to save file to, or if you don’t want to defaults to None

  • extra (int) – extra straight portion to add to ends of waveguides to make room in simulation (input with units same as units input)

  • units (str) – either ‘microns’ or ‘nms’. Units to save gds file in

predict(wavelength, ports=(1, 2))¶

Predicts the output when light is put in the bottom left port (see diagram above)

Parameters

  • wavelength (float/np.ndarray) – wavelength(s) to predict at

  • ports (2-tuple) – Specifies the port coming in and coming out

Returns

returns the value of the light coming through

Return type

k/t (complex np.ndarray)

sparams(wavelength)¶

Returns sparams :param wavelength: wavelengths to get sparams at :type wavelength: float/np.ndarray

Returns

frequency for s_matrix in Hz, size n (number of wavelength points) s_matrix (np.ndarray): size (4,4,n) complex matrix of scattering parameters

Return type

freq (np.ndarray)
